entry.title: Enterprise Service Organization: Simplifying Sales Area Assignment to the Service Transactions
entry.content:
The 2025 FPS0 release introduces a new streamlined method for assigning sales areas to the service transaction types in the Enterprise Organizational Model enabled system. This enhancement is particularly beneficial if customers work exclusively with service process without Sales and Distributions.â€¯ 

Prior to FPS0 2025 release, customers had to create placeholder sales order types to support sales area assignment to the service transactions. This new approach eliminates the need for placeholder sales order type customizations, significantly reduces overhead & maintenance and streamlines the process.â€¯ 

The proposal for Sales Area is based on the following parameters. 

  • BP/Customer  
  • Common Distribution Channel 
  • Common Division 
  • Combine Sales organization, Distribution Channel, Divisionâ€¯â€¯ 

Pre-requisite Customizing    

Enable Enterprise Organizational Model 

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Service -> Basic Functions -> Enterprise Organizational Management -> Enable Enterprise Organizational Model 

Common Distribution Channel, Common Divisionâ€¯ 

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Sales and Distribution -> Master Data

Combine Sales organization, Distribution Channel, Divisionâ€¯â€¯ 

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Sales and Distribution -> Sales -> Sales Documents -> Sales Document Header -> Assign Sales Area to Sales Document Types 

On execute of â€œAssign Sales Area to Sales Document Typesâ€ 

 Assign Sales area for Service transactions 

New Customizing node is introduced on service for sales area assignment to service transaction type 

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Service -> Basic Functions -> Enterprise Organizational Management -> Assign Sales Area to Service Transaction Types 

Example: 

Consider BP/Customer (Sold to Party) has been assigned to 2 sales area as below  

Sales org 

Distribution channel 

Division 

1710 

01 

01 

SJ21 

01 

01 

 

Now maintain the sales area 1710 /01/ 01 to transaction type SRVO using the new customizing  

 

Now create a service order with Transaction type â€œSRVOâ€ 

Sales area proposal will be filtered out based on the above customizing and if unique the same will be assigned to Organization Data else there will be a pop-up with a list of applicable Sales area for user selection.

entry.title: Enterprise Service Organization:â€‹â€‹â€‹ Determination of Service Team via Standard and Custom attributes
entry.content:
In the Enterprise Organizational Model enabled systems, the service team was traditionally determined based on only three standard attributes such as Country, Postal Code, and Enterprise Service Organization. 

However, there are scenarios where it is necessary to include custom attributes also with standard ones to enable more specific service team determination based on transaction-specific parameters. 

With the latest enhancements, it is now possible to determine the service team using both standard and custom attributes defined in the service team responsibility setup. 

To support this enhanced logic, a new BAdI has been introduced: 

BAdI: CRMS4_RM_SRVTEAM_DETERMINATION 

This BAdI enables flexible and enhanced service team determination based on tailored criteria. 

  
How to setup the standard and custom attributes to determine the service team.  

Example objective:  

A specific service team is to be determined when a Service transaction is created for a particular Product as a part of the main reference object.â€¯â€‹ 

This product can beâ€‹ 

  • Directly maintained as the main reference object ORâ€‹ 
  • Reference Product of the Main reference object Equipmentâ€‹ OR 
  • Product of the serialized product  

Prerequisite Customizing. 

Step 1: To define the custom attribute (Z_PRODUCT) into the Service team.â€‹ 

Z_PRODUCT is assigned in the custom Responsibility Definition Name.â€‹ â€¯

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Cross-Application Components -> General Application Functions -> Responsibility Management -> Responsibility Definitions -> Define Custom Responsibility Definitions

 Step 2: Assigning custom attributes to the Team Category Service. 

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Cross-Application Components -> General Application Functions -> Responsibility Management -> Teams and Responsibilities -> Team Categories -> Assign Custom Responsibility Definitions to Team Category

Step 3. Build a service team determination rule with attribute Z_PRODUCT and Source BADIâ€‹ 

  • Add Attribute Z_PRODUCT with source BADI. â€¯

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Service -> Master Data -> Service Teams -> Define Service Team Determination Rules 

Step 4: Register the event of SERVICE_OS to CRMS4_SRVTEAM_DETERM_REG_EC.â€‹ â€¯

Step 5:  Implement the required logic within the BAdI.

SAP Customizing Implementation Guide -> Service -> Master Data -> Service Teams -> BAdI: Determine Service Team from Attributes

 

BAdI Definition Name: CRMS4_RM_SRVTEAM_DETERMINATIONâ€¯ 
BAdI Interface: IF_CRMS4_RM_SRVTEAM_DETâ€¯ 
Method: IS_RELEVANT_FOR_DETERMINATION, READ_ATTRIBUTE_VALUE 

Example implementation is present in the BAdI definition CRMS4_RM_SRVTEAM_DETERMINATION. 

Example implementation class name: CL_CRMS4_SRVTEAM_DET_EXAMPLE 

Step 6. Create a service order. Once the main reference object is entered, the service team will be determined. 

Example:

Let us consider enhancing the service team with custom attributes â€˜Y_PRODUCTâ€™. 

Create a Service Team and maintain value 'S01_FG126' for the attribute Y_PRODUCT. 

 

This product is assigned to the equipment (10000069)

Equipment has this product configured 

 

Create a Service Order and enter the equipment 10000069 as the main reference object 

 

Here the Service team (SERVICE_MS) assigned to this product is displayed and can be selected. If there are no Service team, then there will be no pop-up. 

Note: We also see another Service team â€œSERVICE_NGâ€ which is common service team for all products and no value is assigned to Y_PRODUCT attribute in this service team

entry.title: Re: NB-L in PO
entry.content:
Planned transportation costs in ME21N (NB-L) should be entered during the purchase order creation stage, typically via conditions or freight agreements. Missing costs often stem from configuration gaps or inconsistent use of document types.

Here is a breakdown of your questions:

Where should transportation costs be entered?
In ME21N, transportation costs are typically entered as planned delivery costs using condition types (e.g., FRA1 for freight). These are added in the item details under the â€œConditionsâ€ tab or via header-level conditions depending on your setup. Alternatively, if using shipment cost documents, the costs are linked via Logistics Execution (LE) and transferred to the PO through integration.
 
At which stage should they be planned?
During PO creation (ME21N): Planned transportation costs should be added when the purchase order is created, especially for raw materials like flour. If using shipment cost documents, planning occurs in the transportation planning stage in LE and is later transferred to the PO. Ensure that freight agreements or condition records are maintained in the system so costs are automatically proposed during PO creation.

Why does NB-L appear inconsistently in order history?
NB-L is a variant of the standard NB document type, often used for logistics-related purchase orders. It may appear only when the PO is created via shipment cost document integration. Specific custom configurations route certain POs to NB-L based on vendor, material type, or purchasing organization. If NB-L is missing, it could be due to manual PO creation using standard NB instead of NB-L. Missing or incorrect document type assignment in the configuration for shipment cost processing

So my recommendation would be

  • Check if freight condition types are properly configured and assigned to your vendor/material.
  • Review document type determination settings in SPRO under Logistics Execution â†’ Transportation â†’ Shipment Cost Document â†’ Assign Document Type.
  • Ensure consistent use of NB-L for flour-related purchases if transportation costs are expected to be planned via LE.

entry.title: Modify a report's data source at runtime in C# from Visual Studio
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

I have about 1000 reports developed with 32-bit Crystal Reports (from Crystal Report 9 to SAP Crystal Reports 2016) that use an xBase (dbf) data connection using the crdb_p2bxbse.dll 32 bit library (Crystal Reports database driver for xBase).

Now I need to upgrade to 64-bit Crystal Reports (SAP Crystal Reports 2025) and therefore migrate the reports to a JDBC data connection using CsvJdbc (a read-only JDBC driver that uses  CSV files or DBF files as database tables): using the same data source, the report fields will have a perfect match

I would like to know if it is possible to develop a C# program in Visual Studio for:

  • load the report
  • modify the data connection definition and table references
  • save the report with the new connection

I can do this in SAP Crystal Reports 2025 (even without the crdb_p2bxbse.dll library that work only in 32 bit!), but I would have to do it for all the 1000 reports and I need to generate xBase (dbf) files for each report....

Is it possible to modify a report's data connection at runtime in C# from Visual Studio?

Thank you very much for your attention.

entry.title: Re: How to Maintain User Context When Making Programmatic...
entry.content:
Turns out this isn't a bug at all. I was thinking about it wrong.

I assumed the user context from my HTTP test request would somehow carry over to programmatic queries. It doesn't - and that's by design.

The service layer (srv.run()) is meant for UI/Fiori usage where users should only see their own drafts. It automatically filters by InProcessByUser. In my tests, there's no HTTP request context for the programmatic query, so no user â†’ filters by 'anonymous' â†’ finds nothing.

The fix for tests/admin operations:

Use the database layer to bypass user filtering:

const srv = await cds.connect.to('CatalogService');
const { Books } = srv.entities;

// Get service entity, but query via database
const drafts = await cds.db.run(SELECT.from(Books.drafts).where({ ID: draftID }));

For business logic with user context:

const draft = await srv.tx({ user: new cds.User.Privileged({ id: 'alice' }) }, async (tx) => {
  return tx.run(SELECT.from(Books.drafts).where({ ID: draftID }));
});

Hope this saves someone else the debugging time I spent on this. ðŸ˜…

entry.title: The subject lines of emails sent from Ariba do not display in the language configured in Ariba when
entry.content:
Hello, I am a consultant working on an indirect procurement reform project using SAP Ariba at a manufacturer.

Regarding notification emails sent from Ariba (e.g., approval requests), the following issues have been observed:
ãƒ»In Outlook, portions of the subject line text sometimes appear in a language different from the language set in Ariba (Japanese), such as English.
ãƒ»This occurs not only in the live environment at the client company but also in the test environment.

SAP investigated, but they stated that identifying the cause and developing countermeasures is difficult due to the inherent complexity of the root cause analysis.

The operational impact is as follows:
Users routinely process large volumes of document approvals and creation daily. Consequently, many rely on email filtering based on subject lines.
If email subjects partially contain a different language (English), users utilizing filtering functions may experience missed approvals or confirmations. This could lead to operational delays.

entry.title: Re: High RFC time for Upload/download the Photos/PDF docs...
entry.content: HTTP calls in such cases are time consuming check if Some implementations allow Dolphin Content Server to store files on shared file systems mounted on the SAP server. ABAP can then read/write directly via logical file paths (/usr/sap/<SID>/Dolphin) instead of going over HTTP and then it will be much faster.

  • eg.: https://mysystem.com:44330

Arthur Silva

entry.title: Re: SAP B1
entry.content:
Hi,

you are close to the solution. I respect that you tried it on your own (So you can learn). You need to combine OMLT and MLT1 in  a join

SELECT 
* 
FROM
OMLT /*HeadTable*/
INNER JOIN MLT1 ON MLT1.TranEntry = OMLT.TranEntry /*Translations - bound on Primary-Key TranEntry*/
WHERE 
OMLT.TableName = 'OCTG' /*Table for PymntGroup*/

regards Lothar

entry.title: Budget for Spot Award Programs (Rewards & Recognition)
entry.content:
I have three Annual Award programs (Monetary programs) in my system and as per my understanding and system standard behavior, each program needs to have its own budget manually uploaded within the respective program. 

My Client is looking for an option to have an integrated budget which should be used as a common budget for all the 3 programs. If this budget is uploaded for 1 annual program, it should be automatically applicable to other 2 programs, without the need of maintaining budgets in other two programs. And when the award is granted to the nominee, the budget should get deducted from the common budget, irrespective of which annual award is granted to the nominee.

 For example, if the total budget is 900,000 USD, we do not want to split it as 300,000 USD per program and upload separately to each program, instead, one budget can be uploaded to 1 program and is used by other 2 programs as well..

Could you please confirm whether this functionality is available within the standard RnR programs?

@AndresCarter @lesleyr

entry.title: Re: F4 Search help not working in Application Jobs fiori app in S4/HANA 2023
entry.content:
I think that creating a blog post for each SAP note is not a good idea, because searching would lead to the SAP note anyway. Also, your blog post may become obsolete as soon as new SAP notes are posted on this topic.

Also, add hyperlinks to make life easier.

  • 3564773 - Application Jobs: Value help does not work, although it was added via transaction SAPJ - SAP for Me
    • After you add a search help for a selection parameter in the transaction SAPJ for the class based job catalog, when you open it in the Application Jobs app, you receive an error message stating that the search help was not found.
  • 3558502 - Application Jobs: missing functionality for class based job catalogs in transaction SAPJ - SAP for Me
    • When editing a class-based job catalog, some columns in the parameter table are disabled. Therefore, it is not possible to assign and configure any custom value help from the dictionary to the relevant parameter.
